section.div: Favorites genres: Action, Drama, Comedy, Adventure

div.div: A Bride’s Story tells the tale of a beautiful young bride in nineteenth-century Asia. At the age of twenty, Amir is sent to a neighboring town to be wed. But her surprise at learning her new husband, Karluk, is eight years younger than her is quickly replaced by a deep affection for the boy and his family. Though she hails from just beyond the mountains, Amir’s clan had very different customs, foods, and clothes from what Karluk is used to. As the two of them learn more about each other through their day-to-day lives, the bond of respect and love grows stronger. (Source: Yen Press) Note: Won the Grand Prize at the 7th Manga Taisho Awards.
Zero customers, a naked young lady, and an armed militiaâ€”it's just another post-apocalyptic day for this food truck owner!. (Source: Viz)
Vigilante: Boku no Hero Academia ILLEGALS

In the world of My Hero Academia, not everyone needs a license to fight for justice! In a superpowered society, there is nothing ordinary about evil anymore. Heroes, trained and licensed to protect and defend the public against supervillains, stand above all the rest. Not everyone can be a hero, however, and there are those who would use their powers to serve the people without legal sanction. But do they fight for justice in the shadows, or for reasons known only to themselves? Whatever they fight for, they are calledâ€¦vigilantes. Koichi Haimawari couldnâ€™t make the cut to become an official hero, so he uses his modest Quirk to do good deeds in his spare time. Then one day a fateful encounter with some local thugs leads him to team up with two other unlikely heroes. None of them really know what theyâ€™re doing, but theyâ€™ve got the courageâ€”or foolishnessâ€”to try. But they soon discover fighting evil takes more than just being braveâ€¦ (Source: Viz Media) Note: Includes 7 extra chapters.

Middle school student Izuku Midoriya wants to be a hero more than anything, but he hasnâ€™t got an ounce of power in him. With no chance of ever getting into the prestigious U.A. High School for budding heroes, his life is looking more and more like a dead end. Then an encounter with All Might, the greatest hero of them all, gives him a chance to change his destinyâ€¦ (Source: Viz Media)
<i>Note: - Winner of the 1st Next Manga Award in the Print Category in 2015. - Nominated for the 8thÂ Manga Taisho Award in 2015. - Nominated for the 40thÂ Kodansha Manga Award in theÂ ShounenÂ Category in 2016.<i>

In a world where everyone takes wonders like magic spells and dragons for granted, Coco is a girl with a simple dream: she wants to be a witch. But everybody knows magicians are born, not made, and Coco was not born with a gift for magic. Resigned to her un-magical life, Coco is about to give up on her dream to become a witch â€¦ until the day she meets Qifrey, a mysterious, traveling magician. After secretly seeing Qifrey perform magic in a way sheâ€™s never seen before, Coco soon learns what everybody â€œknowsâ€ might not be the truth, and discovers that her magical dream may not be as far away as it may seem... (Source: Kodansha USA) Notes: - Nominated for the 11th Manga Taishou Award in 2018. - Won Best U.S. Edition of International Material - Asia at the Eisner Awards in 2020. - Won the Best Manga Award at the Harvey Awards in 2020.

Zaha Sankoâ€™s body has great and terrible powersâ€“they say that possessing his bones will grant you any wish, even the desire to become ruler of the universe. But Sanko is still a teenage dude with his own life, and he isnâ€™t about to let every monstrous lowlife in the galaxy rip him limb from limb. He and his skeletal buddy Avakian will use their dark powers to fend off any murder attempts while they search space for whomever put this curse on Sankoâ€™s bonesâ€¦because killing them might end the madness. (Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)

Maruo Eiichirou (E-Chan), a first year honor student, one day decides he's unhappy with the way things are and lacks excerise. He finds a flyer for the Tennis Club and decides check it out. He's instantly captivated by it. With no prior experience and poor physical conditioning, join E-Chan as he embarks on a tennis journey using his smarts, dedication and work ethic. (Source: One Manga) Note: Won the 38th Kodansha Manga Award in the Best Shounen Manga category in 2014. Chapter count includes extras included in volumes 12, 14, 20, 25, 29, 31, 35, 36 and 37.

As a child, Thorfinn sat at the feet of the great Leif Ericson and thrilled to wild tales of a land far to the west. But his youthful fantasies were shattered by a mercenary raid. Raised by the Vikings who murdered his father, Thorfinn became a terrifying warrior, forever seeking to kill the band's leader, Askeladd, and avenge his father. Sustaining Thorfinn through his ordeal are his pride in his family and his dreams of a fertile westward land, a land without war or slavery â€¦ the land Leif called Vinland. (Source: Kodansha USA) Notes: - Won the Grand Prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2009. - Winner of the 36th Kodansha Manga Award in the General category in 2012.

A man working a job far removed from his childhood dreams gets wrapped up in an unexpected situationâ€¦! Becoming a monster, he aims once again to fulfill his lifelong dreamâ€¦!
(Source: MANGA Plus)
<i>Note: - Nominated for the 14thÂ Manga Taisho Award in 2021. - Winner of the 7th Next Manga Award in the Web Manga Category in 2021.<i>

In this new action-comedy, everything about a young man named Saitama screams "AVERAGE,” from his lifeless expression, to his bald head, to his unimpressive physique. However, this average-looking fellow doesn't have your average problem... He's actually a superhero that's looking for tough opponents! The problem is, every time he finds a promising candidate he beats the snot out of them in one punch. Can Saitama finally find an evil villain strong enough to challenge him? Follow Saitama through his hilarious romps as he searches for new bad guys to challenge!
(Source: Viz Media)
